pr_title: Allow AppArtifact to have more than one path

timeline.bodyText: @stuartwdouglas please check this one. I am adding the root application artifact here. I think it's ok because all the deps are added here besides the root artifact. Full deployment deps above already contain the "user deps".
timeline.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText:
This does not look right, this should be in the deployment CL instead.
In dev mode this CL is persistent, so if you include parts of the application then any changes will not be visible.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: What about the local projects that appear as "user deps" and among the full deployment dependencies?
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText: BTW, there would be test failures if I added it in the deployment CL.
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText: Local projects that are extension dependencies and this not hot reloadable are fine, but we can't have anything hot reloadable here.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: Isn't it happening here https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/independent-projects/bootstrap/core/src/main/java/io/quarkus/bootstrap/app/CuratedApplication.java#L172 ? Full deployment deps include all the user configured runtime deps including the local hot reloadable projects, afaiu.
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, looks like this is an existing problem.
In practice it should be fine as the relevant classes should always be loaded from the runtime/deployment class loader.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

timeline.bodyText:
This needs to be thread safe.
Normally we don't want mutable build items but for this use case this makes sense, as we only want these to be produced as side effects.
timeline.author: stuartwdouglas

timeline.bodyText: This should probably catch Throwable, just to make sure everything gets closed.
timeline.author: stuartwdouglas

timeline.bodyText: Do we actually want this? If we forget to update it we could have weird errors when upgrading.
timeline.author: stuartwdouglas

timeline.bodyText: This is pretty ugly. I'm still waiting for the CI to see if it fixes it.

replies.bodyText: Not yet, single path is assertive, it'll throw an exception in case there are more. In our current impl (not this PR but actually current codebase) we actually pick the first path in a few places.

timeline.message: Avoid SmallRye's PropertiesConfigSourceProvider that causes the JARs to stay locked on Windows
Avoid URL.openStream() where possible

* Refactoring of AppArtifact to allow more than one path as its content. This is necessary, for example, to represent not yet packaged Gradle projects.

* Introduce QuarkusBuildCloseablesBuildItem that can be used to collect various instances of Closeable that should be closed at the end of the build.

* Moved the JAR renaming logic when uber-jar=true from the build step to BuildMojo to avoid running into JAR locking issue on Windows.

* Introduce utility methods to read URLs as InputStreams in a way that does not lock JARs on Windows.

* Avoid URL.openConnection() and URL.openStream() calls where possible to avoid JAR locking issues on Windows.
